experience: You and Julie both know Helenmarie Mendoza Slater, SPHR, SHRM-SCP, Akshai J. Patel, and 6 others

I manage education and outreach initiatives at TGen that increase the community's working knowledge of genomics and educate, train and inspire the next generation of researchers and physicians.We seek and establish productive partnerships with local academic institutions, businesses, and community and government leaders, and initiate innovative education and outreach programs and joint ventures. Current initiatives include our flagship internship program Helios Scholars at TGen, academic year internships, events supporting the Arizona SciTech Festival, support for the Arizona Science and Engineering Fair, public tours, and more.

My main focus is managing the Helios Scholars at TGen summer internship program. The Helios Scholars program is a paid summer internship in which students conduct their own research project under the direction of a TGen scientist.Additionally, I represent TGen at community outreach events and career fairs to improve the public's understanding and awareness of biomedical research at TGen and in general. Within the organization, I lead tours and connect scientists with qualified student interns.

I developed a sampling strategy, provided data collection training, and conducted literature reviews for the "Obesity Stigma and Upward Mobility" research project in the Culture, Health and Environment Lab in the School of Human Evolution and Social Change.

As an anthropology graduate student, I assisted in teaching the following courses:-Bones, Stones and Human Evolution (an introduction to physical anthropology)-Death and Dying in Cross-cultural Perspective-Introduction to Global Health-PrimatologyOverall, I was a teaching assistant for 5 semesters during the academic year and 1 semester during the summer.
I assisted in the cleaning, reconstructing and analysis of human skeletal remains from an archaeological site in the Sudan.
Anthropology and English with a minor in Biology
Anthropology and English with a minor in Biology
I am a mentor to an incredibly bright and promising high school student in the New Pathways program.

I tweet for YNPN Phoenix at @ynpnPHX highlighting upcoming events, professional development opportunities, and current non-profit news.

I chaired the annual fundraiser for three years and updated the organization's email and newsletter platform. Currently, I am editor of their online newsletter.

We were lucky to have him as a day-to-day mentor in our program!
